attributes.action: Abandon the additional £1m Premium Bond Prize
attributes.additional_details:
The Chancellor has increase the amount of Premium Bonds an investor can hold to the maximum of £40,000 and added another £1 million prize.

This is unfair to investors who don't have the means to buy £40,000 worth of Premium Bonds.

The Chancellor should not encourage financial greed by  treating Premium Bonds like the Lottery and use the additional £1 million to provide more smaller prizes to improve investors chances.
